prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: Group1_tuning1
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Find emission line in frequency range of tunning 1 for group 1 of DSFG targets.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We set the correlator resolution to the minimum necessary to detect the spectral lines with at least 6 frequency bins, as we are only interested in the line central frequency.
We chose the lowest angular resolution that could fit the expected sources entirely to maximize the signal to noise in the measured lines.

Given that the main science goal is to detect lines to measure redshift, a S/N of 5 for a 10 mJy line seems reasonable given what the SPT group found for similar sources. The bandwidth was maximized to increase the chances to find lines for sources of unknown redshift.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: The study of high-redshift dusty star-forming galaxies (DSFGs) is important for understanding galaxy formation and evolution, as they may be the progenitors of the most massive local elliptical galaxies. We have indetified 21 new DSFG candidates in the Atacama Cosmology Telescope (ACT) equatorial maps using all three available frequency bands (150, 220 and 280 GHz) and disregarding sources with obvious local counterparts and/or strong radio fluxes. Follow-up observations have been done using SMA and GISMO to improve the positional accuracy for most of them. This proposal aim to detect CO emission lines over a wide frequency range and thus to determine our sample's redshift distribution. The results will be very valuable for fully characterizing this source population, including the relatice roles of strong lensing and complex merging in driving their high fluxes.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
